title: globalwindatlas
globalwindatlas
code: # install.packages("geodata") library(globalwindatlas) library(terra) #> terra 1.7.39 library(sf) #> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.6.2, PROJ 9.2.0; sf_use_s2() is TRUE library(ggplot2)  ## set directory to store downloaded files gwa_set_dir("data/gwa")

title: globalwindatlas
code: ## download wind capacity factors  # gwa_get_wind_cf("BGD", IEC = 1) # wind-class #1 gwa_get_wind_cf("BGD", IEC = 2) # wind-class #2 #> [1] "data/gwa/BGD_capacity_factor_IEC2.tif" # gwa_get_wind_cf("BGD", IEC = 3) # wind-class #3  ## download wind speed data gwa_get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 100) #> [1] "data/gwa/BGD_wind_speed_100.tif" # gwa_get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 150) # gwa_get_wind_speed("BGD", height = 200)  # select data to plot obj <- gwa_get_wind_cf("BGD", IEC = 2)  ## plot  tr <- rast(obj) plot(tr, main = "Wind capacity factors") summary(tr) #> Warning: [summary] used a sample #>  BGD_capacity_factor_IEC2 #>  Min.   :0.01             #>  1st Qu.:0.15             #>  Median :0.19             #>  Mean   :0.20             #>  3rd Qu.:0.25             #>  Max.   :0.41             #>  NA's   :49764

what: Group locations by intervals of capacity factor
title: globalwindatlas
code: ggplot(gwa_iec2_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = eq), color = NA) +   scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "H", direction = 1, name = "CF") +   theme_bw()

title: Authors and Citation
Authors and Citation
text: Lugovoy O (2023). globalwindatlas: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data GIS/tif GlobalWindAtlas.info. R package version 2023.07.05.9000, https://github.com/energyRt/globalwindatlas.
code: @Manual{,   title = {globalwindatlas: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info},   author = {Oleg Lugovoy},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 2023.07.05.9000},   url = {https://github.com/energyRt/globalwindatlas}, }

what: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: package assists downloading processing high-resolution (250m grid) maps averaged wind potential Global Wind Atlas. data might useful energy systems modeling selections locations high wind energy potential. Documentation: https://energyrt.github.io/globalwindatlas/index.html

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: can install development version globalwindatlas GitHub :

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(globalwindatlas) ## set directory for downloaded files, also will be used for quick files access gwa_set_dir("data/gwa") ## download wind capacity factors for wind-class #1 gwa_get_wind_cf("ISL", IEC = 1) #> [1] "data/gwa/ISL_capacity_factor_IEC1.tif" ## download wind speed data ISL <- gwa_get_wind_cf("ISL", IEC = 2) # Iceland ISL #> [1] "data/gwa/ISL_capacity_factor_IEC2.tif"  MAR <- gwa_get_wind_speed("MAR", height = 150) # Morocco  ## plot data library(terra) #> terra 1.7.29 plot(rast(MAR), main = "Morocco, wind speed at 150m height, m/s") plot(rast(ISL), main = "Iceland, wind capacity factors, class 2")

title: Access high-resolution (250m) wind potential data in GIS/tif from GlobalWindAtlas.info

Download wind capacity factors for a country — get_wind_capacity_factor
code: get_wind_capacity_factor(   country,   IEC = 2,   path = get_gwa_dir(),   filename = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Download wind capacity factors for a country — get_wind_capacity_factor
text: country isocode (three letters) country (case sensitive) IEC wind class (1, 2, 3) according International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) path optional path directory saving downloaded file filename optional file-name overwrite logical, file overwritten exists

what: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
text: Group locations intervals values given tiff-file return geometries groups.

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
code: gwa_group_locations(   gwa_tif,   gis_sf = NULL,   by_feature = TRUE,   ID = NULL,   int = seq(0, 1, by = 0.1),   aggregate_tif = 0,   snap_to_grid = 1e-05,   simplify = 0.001,   buffer = 100,   drop_crumps = units::set_units(10, "km^2"),   verbose = T,   plot_process = T )

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
text: gwa_tif tiff-file (terra-object) gis_sf optional sf object (map) crop gwa-tif by_feature logical, grouping done geometry (row sf-object), TRUE default (recommended large objects), FALSE geometries merged one. ID character, identification column sf-object. provided, geometries merged IDs. int numeric, intervals values grouping locations aggregate_tif (optional) integer, number pixels tiff aggregation towards x y directions (see fact parameter terra::aggregate details). default value 0 (aggregation). snap_to_grid (optional) numeric size grid. positive, geometries adjusted closest grid (see grid_size argument s2::s2_snap_to_grid). default value 1e-5 lon/lat coordinates. simplify numeric, tolerance, minimum distance nodes units crs (.e. degrees long/lat, see ?terra::simplifyGeom details). Default value 0.1. skip step set value 0. buffer numeric. positive, buffer added every geometry.  Unit meter gwa_tif gis_sf longitude/latitude CRS, units coordinate reference system cases (typically also meter, see ?terra::buffer details). default value 100. Set 0 skip step. drop_crumps logical, TRUE, small geometries dropped. verbose logical, process reported. plot_process logical, plot process creation geometries.

title: Group locations by intervals of values in given tiff-file and return geometries of the groups. — gwa_group_locations
text: sf object geometries group, defined intervals.
